alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 9:32AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Heavy rainfall is possible with convection late this afternoon into tonight, soils are likely already saturated in many areas and excessive runoff is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH 6 AM TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Most of the plains south of the South Platte River, including the Palmer Divide, eastern Adams and Arapahoe Counties, and Washington and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM MDT this evening through 6 AM tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall of already saturated soils may cause excessive runoff across the warning area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
